identity.name: TaxAssist
identity.theme_strategy: Light Mode Dominant (Trust) with High-Contrast Dark Accents (Authority)

headings.usage: Use for all H1-H3. Tight tracking (-0.02em).

body.usage: Use for all body text, UI elements, and data tables.

mono.usage: Use for financial figures, tax codes, and IDs.

primary.description: Deep Forest Green - Represents growth, money, and stability.

secondary.description: Bone White / Sand - Paper-like, organic background.

accent.description: Terracotta - For primary CTAs and alerts. Warm but urgent.

visual_enhancers.texture: Add a subtle noise texture (opacity 0.03) to all solid backgrounds to avoid 'digital flatness'.
visual_enhancers.shadows: Use 'layered' shadows: shadow-sm + shadow-xl (low opacity) for depth.
visual_enhancers.borders: 1px solid borders with 10% opacity for a crisp, technical look.
visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use backdrop-blur-xl with bg-white/80 for sticky headers and modals.
visual_enhancers.gradients: NO full-screen gradients. Use subtle mesh gradients only in 'Tracing Beam' borders.

layout_strategy.spacing: Generous. Use p-8 to p-12 for section padding. Gap-6 to Gap-8 for grids.

grid_system.dashboard: Mode B: High Density Grid (Functional, Dense).

layout_strategy.containers: Max-width 1400px for dashboards, 1200px for reading content.

buttons.style: Sharp edges (rounded-sm) or Pill (rounded-full). High contrast.

cards.style: Flat background, 1px border, no default shadow. Hover adds shadow and lift.
cards.special: Use 'Tracing Beam' effect for Pricing Plans.

inputs.style: Minimalist. bg-transparent border-b border-input focus:border-primary focus:ring-0 rounded-none px-0.
inputs.note: For complex forms, use standard boxed inputs with rounded-md.

navigation.sidebar: Fixed left, dark mode (Deep Forest Green) for Admin.

media.icons: Use 'lucide-react' for standard UI. Use 'phosphor-icons' (Duotone) for feature highlights.

motion.micro_interactions: Buttons scale 0.98 on click. Links have underline slide animation.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure 4.5:1 contrast for text. Use APCA standards.

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Tetris Grid' for the Landing Page hero section.
Use the 'Deep Forest Green' sidebar for the Admin Panel to distinguish it from the Client App.
Ensure all forms use 'react-hook-form' with 'zod' validation.
Add 'data-testid' to every interactive element (buttons, inputs, links).
Do NOT use generic 'SaaS Blue'. Stick to the Green/Bone/Terracotta palette.
For the Document Upload section, use a large drag-and-drop zone with the 'minimal_desk' image as a subtle background overlay.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories (especially sponsor logos) = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable
Create new components that match the style and conventions of existing components when needed
Examine existing components to understand the project's component patterns before creating new ones
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...)
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...})
Use 'sonner' for toasts. Sonner component are located in /app/src/components/ui/sonner.tsx
